medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient experienced 3 days of abdominal pain localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and decreased appetite. On the day of presentation, the patient fell from his bed due to the pain and spent the majority of the day trying to reach a phone to call an ambulance. The patient also reported subjective fevers, anorexia, and fatigue, with no nausea or vomiting and no change in stools.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes Mellitus Type 2, Hypertension, Chronic Kidney Disease (nephrotic syndrome, baseline creatinine 2.1-2.6), history of alcohol abuse (quit not specified)
